item.title: Solving an ODE that has a convolution with RK4
item.description: In this note I document stuff I remembered doing back when I was taking Numerical Methods I. We’ll get the idea from Euler method, then extend it up to a family of method called Runge-Kutta. The Runge-Kutta 4th order is the final step, and is considered the one ring to rule all ODEs. Euler method Let say we have a first-order differential equation problem \[\begin{align} \dfrac{dx}{dt} - f(t, x) = 0,\ x(t_0) = x_0 \end{align}\]
